main event: On February 9, 1967, two women reported seeing a circular object with a reddish-orange glow hovering over Sioux City, Iowa.
interesting points: The women observed the object for about 10 to 15 minutes and reported it was silent and rotating., The object was seen at an altitude of approximately 1,000 feet., The incident was reported to the Sioux City Police, who then alerted Air Force radar operators., The radar operators confirmed tracking the object for 15 to 20 minutes., Capt. George Fyffe, who investigated the sighting, found the witnesses to be sincere in their account.
witness description: two women, Irene Lair and Jeroldine Armbust
